entries.meaning: A journey made to a sacred place, or a religious journey.
examples: In the Muslim faith, the pilgrimage to Mecca is known as the Hajj.

entries.meaning: (by extension) A visit to any site revered or associated with a meaningful event.
examples: Each year we made a pilgrimage to New York City to visit the pub where we all first met.

verbs.description: pilgrimage (third-person singular simple present pilgrimages, present participle pilgrimaging, simple past and past participle pilgrimaged)
